page.title: 17EDUCATION : SPECIAL PROV.
page.content: There are 2 establishments within the block which cater for children with special needs as defind by the 1981 Education Act. Both were established prior to the Act and continue to fulfill their original purpose. Both are attached to normal schools. At Cledford County Infants School there is an Assessment Unit, and at Middlewich County Infant School a Partial Hearing Unit. Both are small groups staffed by one teacher and one classroom assistant, and the children are brought by taxi at the Authority's expense from all areas of South Cheshire. The partial hearing unit is equipped with radio aids which are small radio receivers tuned to a transmitter worn by the teacher. Children transfer to a similar unit at Middlewich County Junior School.
